articles.headline: Democrats Prepare Bills to Tighten Loan Rules
articles.snippet: The rules would prohibit a range of practices used to market subprime loans to people with weak credit histories.
articles.abstract: The rules would prohibit a range of practices used to market subprime loans to people with weak credit histories.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5  Democrats in Congress are planning to introduce bills in the coming days that would prohibit a range of practices used to market subprime loans to people with weak credit histories or low incomes.

articles.headline: Envisioning the Next Chapter for Electronic Books
articles.snippet: Two new offerings from Web giants this fall will test if consumers are ready to leave the paper book behind.
articles.abstract: Two new offerings from Web giants this fall will test if consumers are ready to leave the paper book behind.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 5 — Technology evangelists have predicted the emergence of electronic books for as long as they have envisioned flying cars and video phones. It is an idea that has never caught on with mainstream book buyers.

articles.headline: Big Gifts, Tax Breaks and a Debate on Charity
articles.snippet: Some ask if the public benefits of philanthropy are worth the tax breaks that givers receive.
articles.abstract: Some ask if the public benefits of philanthropy are worth the tax breaks that givers receive.
articles.lead_paragraph: Eli Broad, a billionaire businessman, has given away more than $650 million over the last five years, to Harvard and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology to establish a medical research institute, to the Los Angeles County Museum of Art and to programs to improve the administration of urban schools and public education.

articles.headline: Stocks Slip as Fed Says Credit Crisis Is Contained
articles.snippet: Reports showed deepening trouble in the housing market even as the Fed found little evidence that the turmoil had damaged the wider economy.
articles.abstract: Reports showed deepening trouble in the housing market even as the Fed found little evidence that the turmoil had damaged the wider economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: Stocks fell yesterday as investors were unsettled by reports that showed the troubles in the housing market were deepening even as a Federal Reserve survey of regional conditions found little evidence of the turmoil’s having damaged other parts of the economy.
articles.byline: By Vikas Bajaj and Edmund L. Andrews

articles.headline: Despite DNA Test, a Case Is Retried
articles.snippet: Prosecutors in Mississippi have sought a new capital murder trial after DNA evidence overturned a conviction.
articles.abstract: Prosecutors in Mississippi have sought a new capital murder trial after DNA evidence overturned a conviction.
articles.lead_paragraph: MACON, Miss., Aug. 31 — The scene in the tiny Noxubee County jail on a rainy afternoon has become almost commonplace. Kennedy Brewer, sentenced to death and locked up for 15 years for the rape and murder of a 3-year-old, was released on the strength of a DNA test showing that the semen in the rape kit was not his.

articles.headline: Clinton Donor Fails to Appear in Court Again
articles.snippet: Norman Hsu, the wealthy Clinton donor who turned out to be a fugitive, failed to appear in court on Wednesday.
articles.abstract: Norman Hsu, the wealthy Clinton donor who turned out to be a fugitive, failed to appear in court on Wednesday.
articles.lead_paragraph: The mystery of Norman Hsu, the wealthy Clinton donor who turned out to be a fugitive from justice, took a bizarre twist yesterday when Mr. Hsu, who skipped out after pleading no contest in a California fraud case 15 years ago, disappeared yet again.
articles.byline: By Leslie Wayne and Carolyn Marshall

articles.headline: Apple Cuts iPhone Price Ahead of Holidays
articles.snippet: Apple also introduced a new digital music player modeled after the iPhone and announced a wireless music distribution deal with Starbucks.
articles.abstract: Apple also introduced a new digital music player modeled after the iPhone and announced a wireless music distribution deal with Starbucks.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 5 — Apple unexpectedly cut the price of its iPhone Wednesday, claiming that it was seeking to broaden the market for the popular but expensive phone for the Christmas season.

articles.headline: High-Speed Video Store in the Living Room
articles.snippet: Vudu’s new $400 movie box, to be available at month’s end, offers a choice of nearly 5,000 films.
articles.abstract: Vudu’s new $400 movie box, to be available at month’s end, offers a choice of nearly 5,000 films.
articles.lead_paragraph: If you had to make a master list of all the world’s problems, “limited access to movies” probably wouldn’t appear until Page 273,996.

articles.headline: German Police Arrest 3 in  Terrorist Plot
articles.snippet: The three Islamic militants arrested on Wednesday were in the advanced stages of plotting large-scale attacks against several sites frequented by Americans, officials said.
articles.abstract: The three Islamic militants arrested on Wednesday were in the advanced stages of plotting large-scale attacks against several sites frequented by Americans, officials said.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article was reported by Mark Landler, Nicholas Kulish and Souad Mekhennet, and written by Mr. Landler.
